page.title: 172 Playground games-Girls
page.content: SKIPPING is more of a sport than a game as it is also used for keeping fit. You need a rope long enough to step over when held at either end with out- stretched arms;keeping the arms as still as possible circle the rope over your head either backwards or forwards, as the rope comes back to your feet step or jump over it. There are many variations. Many children make up or say traditional rhymes to go to this movement. KNIVES,FORKS SPOONS is a game where a girl stands facing the others and says these words and on the word "spoons" they all stand on their hands and the girl who stays up the longest changes places with the girl at the front and it carries on. It can be played with as few as 3 or as many as the girl judging can see at one time. There are very few playground games compared with old times.
